Notes: School – CedarBridge Academy – closed until further notice to due to confirmed positive covid-19 case as per new protocol announced  1st December. http://web.archive.org/web/20201214235030/https://www.gov.bm/articles/ministry-education-announce-covid-19-developments-cedarbridge-academy

As per Dec 1 protocols, and Dec 7 covid case, CedarBridge Academy is suspended until and including Dec 18. In the interest of continuity from the previous coding level of 2, I've labeled the closing of this school as a 2T. Also, the territory is quite small, and there are few schools, so it might reasonably be considered closing an area of schooling.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210109094433/https://bernews.com/2020/12/cedarbridge-staff-students-quarantine/

In December, the minister of education announced that "Public Schools to Open Remotely in the [first week of] January", from the 5th to the 12th.    Webarchive down. Needs to be saved  https://www.gov.bm/articles/public-schools-open-remotely-january?fbclid=IwAR2GcKV39zUzL713uCkVCp1hk2noXiQhQuXPgLp7rmIQnXW-tT11Bp9aDvE
Indoor Bars and Nightclubs are closed as of 8th December http://web.archive.org/web/20201214230002/https://www.gov.bm/coronavirus-recreation
Existing outdoor bars are permitted to operate with table service only until 10p.m as of 12th December. http://web.archive.org/web/20201214230412/https://www.gov.bm/nightclubs-and-bars-guidance

Public events like Gombey Troupe performances are still occurring, but with increased rules and regulations.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210109094644/https://www.gov.bm/articles/covid-19-update-minister-national-security-remarks-30-december-2020

The maximum permitted number of people in any group will be reduced further to ten. http://web.archive.org/web/20201215001740/https://www.gov.bm/articles/ministerial-statement-covid-19-%E2%80%93-need-further-action

On 11th December 2020, The Department of Public Transportation (DPT) advised the public that the public bus service will be suspended until further notice pending advice from the Ministry of Health.   The DPT announced that one (1) member of staff has tested positive for COVID-19. The department is liaising with the Epidemiology and Surveillance Unit for guidance. Out of an abundance of caution and to ensure the safety of others, the decision has been made to suspend the public bus service until an assessment from the Ministry of Health is completed.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201215000417/https://www.gov.bm/articles/public-bus-service-suspended-until-further-notice

Bermuda transport ministry has announced on Dec 15 that "Public Bus Service Anticipated to Resume Thursday [Dec 17]"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210109094734/https://www.gov.bm/articles/public-bus-service-anticipated-resume-thursday

Effective from 12th December a curfew will be in effect from 11pm until 6am daily. http://web.archive.org/web/20201215001740/https://www.gov.bm/articles/ministerial-statement-covid-19-%E2%80%93-need-further-action
None found

On 11th December, The Minister of Finance, the Hon Curtis L. Dickinson, authorised unemployment benefit payments to individuals whose ability to earn an income has been directly impacted by the recent measures the government has taken to reduce the spread of COVID-19. These benefit payments pertain to verified full-time employees of bars and nightclubs who have had to close due to current COVID-19 restrictions. The total benefit for these persons will be $1,000 for the two week period that these restrictions are in place. http://web.archive.org/web/20201215002252/https://www.gov.bm/articles/unemployment-benefits-11-december-2020

Supplemental Unemployment Benefit (SUB) program continues. Particular focus has been on reaching the new waves of unemployed in the restaurant sector after the Dec 7th restrictions.  "The SUB would be paid once a month and the programme will run until 31st March 2021" https://web.archive.org/web/20201130210057/https://www.gov.bm/articles/minister-finance-press-conference-remarks-30-november-2020
None found.
Public information campaigns online (facebook and whatsapp), and the government tracing app are being used.

The government and Premier have reiterated that testing and contact tracing is working. https://web.archive.org/web/20210109094058/https://www.gov.bm/articles/covid-19-update-%E2%80%93-premier%E2%80%99s-remarks-22-december-2020

The government and Premier have reiterated that testing and contact tracing is working. https://web.archive.org/web/20210109094058/https://www.gov.bm/articles/covid-19-update-%E2%80%93-premier%E2%80%99s-remarks-22-december-2020
If social distancing cannot be maintained, then masks are required in public spaces.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210109094305/https://www.gov.bm/mask-guidance

Bermuda has two sources for procuring vaccines against COVID-19.  Bermuda will be supplied with 9,000 doses of the Pfizer vaccine and they will arrive on our shores in the first week of January 2021.   The second vaccine source is through Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance Geneva, which is administering the COVID-19 Vaccine Global Access Facility (the “COVAX Facility”). Bermuda has joined the COVAX Facility, and has purchased enough doses to cover 20% of our population. The leading vaccines likely to be received by Bermuda are those by AstraZeneca and Moderna. The timeframe for receipt of these vaccines through the COVAX Facility is not yet settled.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201215000755/https://www.gov.bm/articles/ministerial-statement-covid-19-vaccine-bermuda

Effective 14 December, publicly-funded elementary and secondary schools in the Province of Saskatchewan switched to online learning until at least 11 January. See Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201214232830/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-public-schools-in-regina-switch-to-remote-learning-as-covid-19-cases/

Although not as restrictive as in some Canadian jurisdictions, effective 7 December, the province of Prince Edward Island (PEI) closed all recreational and fitness facilities, casinos, bingo halls and other gaming establishments as well as museums and libraries; restricted restaurants and bars to take-out and delivery; and imposed a 50% capacity limit on retail stores. See government of PEI website, archived  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207125737/https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/information/health-and-wellness/pei-covid-19-circuit-breaker-december-2020

Effective Dec. 13, working from home is mandatory in the Province of Alberta when physical presence is not required. Restaurants and bars are restricted to take-out service. Retail outlets are restricted to the lesser of 15% of firecode capacity or 5 customers. All entertainment businesses and entities as well as personal and wellness services must close. See Government of Alberta website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201211114009/https://www.alberta.ca/release.cfm?xID=75859ADEA5D5E-045D-2386-0CB140C175A800DD

Effective 14 December, the Province of Ontario issued the following orders for the Windsor-Essex region (neighbouring Detroit, Michigan) and York region (suburban Toronto): retail stores must close for indoor shopping except those that sell groceries, drugs or hardware, which must respect a 50-per-cent capacity limit; restaurants restricted to takeout or delivery; gyms and hair salons must close. This order brings these regions in line with Toronto and the suburban Peel region. The York region member of the provincial Parliament expressed her disagreement with how the order applies to the retail sector. See Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201219193748/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-ontario-moves-two-more-regions-into-lockdown-in-bid-to-contain-covid/

Although not as restrictive as in some provinces, effective 19 December, the Province of Saskatchewan ordered casinos and other gaming houses to close and restricted personal care service establishments such as hair salons to 50 per cent capacity. See Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201219200259/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-saskatchewan-bans-household-visits-will-limit-retail-capacity-starting/?+First+Canadians+vaccinated+against+COVID-19+=&cu_id=A6KwM2NPqY9Tjy01oPJvjyThBi3rn%2FLU

Effective 21 December, the Province of Ontario issued the following orders for the Hamilton region (west of Toronto): retail stores must close for indoor shopping except those that sell groceries, drugs or hardware, which must respect a 50-per-cent capacity limit; restaurants restricted to takeout or delivery; gyms and hair salons must close. This order brings Hamilton in line with the City of Toronto and suburban regions as well as Windsor-Essex (neighbouring Detroit). See Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221203858/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-coronavirus-updates-dec-19-vaccinations-now-underway-in-all-provinces/?cu_id=A6KwM2NPqY9Tjy01oPJvjyThBi3rn%2FLU

On 22 December, the Globe and Mail newspaper reported on lockdown resistance protests in different regions of Canada. See article in Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210102131027/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/alberta/article-five-charged-in-calgary-as-police-take-more-aggressive-approach-to/?cu_id=A6KwM2NPqY9Tjy01oPJvjyThBi3rn%2FLU

Effective 7 December, the province of Prince Edward Island (PEI) banned organized sport and restricted religious, funeral and wedding services to 10 persons plus presiding officials. See government of PEI website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207125737/https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/information/health-and-wellness/pei-covid-19-circuit-breaker-december-2020

Effective 7 December, the province of Prince Edward Island (PEI) restricted indoor and outdoor gatherings to 10 persons. See government of PEI website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207125737/https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/information/health-and-wellness/pei-covid-19-circuit-breaker-december-2020

Effective 8 December, the Province of Alberta prohibited all indoor and outdoor social gatherings and limited close contacts to within each household except for persons living alone restricted to 2 in-person visitors who must always be the same 2. See Government of Alberta website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201211114009/https://www.alberta.ca/release.cfm?xID=75859ADEA5D5E-045D-2386-0CB140C175A800DD

Effective 17 December, the Province of Saskatchewan restricted outdoor gatherings to 10 people and indoor gatherings to immediate household members. See Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201219200259/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-saskatchewan-bans-household-visits-will-limit-retail-capacity-starting/?+First+Canadians+vaccinated+against+COVID-19+=&cu_id=A6KwM2NPqY9Tjy01oPJvjyThBi3rn%2FLU

On 5 January, Leger, a well-known Canadian public opinion research and polling firm, released a survey showing that 48% of respondents in a sample designed to be representative of Canada’s population ignored public health advice to stay home over the holidays and participated in at least one gathering with participants from outside the household. See Leger website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210106200207/https://leger360.com/surveys/legers-north-american-tracker-january-5-2021/

Although not as prescriptive as some Canadian jurisdictions, effective 7 December, the province of Prince Edward Island (PEI) asked residents to work and shop from home whenever possible. See government of PEI website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207125737/https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/information/health-and-wellness/pei-covid-19-circuit-breaker-december-2020

On 22 December, the Premiers of Ontario and Quebec questioned whether the Canadian government’s border control rules were strict enough. Federal Ministers responded with a defence of the current rules. See Canadian Press article in Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210102125903/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-canada-increases-screening-of-travellers-from-britain-to-monitor-for/?cu_id=A6KwM2NPqY9Tjy01oPJvjyThBi3rn%2FLU

Effective 23 December, the Government of Canada suspended flights from the United Kingdom from landing in Canada through 6 January while Canada “working with international partners, including the World Health Organization, (works) to better understand …. the genetic variant of the virus that causes COVID-19 … identified in the United Kingdom”. See Government of Canada website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221150238/https://www.canada.ca/en/public-health/news/2020/12/canada-suspends-flights-from-the-united-kingdom-for-72-hours.html

On 29 December, the Government of Canada reminded Canadians of the advisory against non-essential travel and that contravening the mandatory 14-day quarantine for most travellers returning from out of the country was subject to penalty. The government release included data indicating that current border controls are effective limiting covid-19 transmission. See Government of Canada website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201231071138/https://www.canada.ca/en/public-health/news/2020/12/contravening-mandatory-quarantine-requirements-can-result-in-severe-penalties.html

On 1 January, an exchange of views about politicians on personal trips outside Canada made clear that federal and provincial public health advisories against non-essential international travel are not binding and open to interpretation. See article on Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210104225339/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-jason-kenney-will-not-discipline-minister-chief-of-staff-for-december/?cu_id=A6KwM2NPqY9Tjy01oPJvjyThBi3rn%2FLU

Effective 7 January, Transport Canada requires the following from all air travellers aged 5 and up entering Canada (including Canadians returning home):  “Documentation of a negative laboratory PCR test result must be presented to the airline prior to boarding a flight to Canada. The test … must be taken within 72 hours prior to the traveller’s scheduled departure to Canada. Anyone who receives a negative test result and is authorized to enter Canada must still complete the full, mandatory 14-day quarantine. The Government of Canada will be further increasing surveillance efforts to ensure travellers entering Canada complete the applicable mandatory 14-day quarantine period under the Quarantine Act. As has been the case for months, all travellers will have their quarantine plans reviewed by a government official and, if not suitable, will be required to quarantine in a federal quarantine facility.” Previously, a negative rapid antigen test was required. With the new testing regime in place, Canada ended the ban on flights from the United Kingdom that started on 23 December. See Government of Canada website and Global news website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210104225935/https://www.canada.ca/en/transport-canada/news/2020/12/pre-departure-covid-19-testing-and-negative-results-to-be-required-for-all-air-travellers-coming-to-canada.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210107151506/https://globalnews.ca/news/7558741/coronavirus-uk-flight-ban-canada-end/

On 17 December, Statistics Canada released data showing that a record high 1.2 million Canadians received Employment Insurance (EI) benefits for unemployment in October. Together with self-employed Canada Recovery Benefit (CRB) recipients and other CRB recipients not eligible for EI, over 2 million Canadians (or over 10% of the pre-pandemic labour force) were receiving a job-related income support benefit from the federal government in October.   See Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221195204/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/business/article-canadians-on-ei-surges-to-record-in-october-after-cerb-transfer/?cu_id=A6KwM2NPqY9Tjy01oPJvjyThBi3rn%2FLU

Effective 20 December, the federal Minister of Finance “announced that the government has concluded the necessary regulatory changes to raise the maximum (Canada Emergency) Wage Subsidy rate to 75 per cent” until 13 March 2021. See Government of Canada website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221151917/https://www.canada.ca/en/department-finance/news/2020/12/government-announces-wage-subsidy-rate-increase-to-75-per-cent.html

On 29 December, the Globe and Mail newspaper reported on slow implementation of the federal government’s new Highly Affected Sectors Credit Availability Program to help businesses in tourism, hospitality, air travel and entertainment with fully government-guaranteed financing. See article in Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210102225155/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/politics/article-struggling-sectors-still-waiting-for-promised-relief-from-federal/?cu_id=A6KwM2NPqY9Tjy01oPJvjyThBi3rn%2FLU

On 4 January, Quebec Minister of Health Christian Dubé tweeted “To bring down cases, we need your co-operation for the tracing done by public health” indicating that contact tracing may not be as timely and comprehensive in practice as earlier in the crisis. See Global news website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210107191838/https://globalnews.ca/news/7553481/quebec-coronavirus-covid-19-jan-4-2021/

On 5 January, Alberta Health reported employing 1,250 contact tracers at the end of 2020, short of their announced target of 1,600. Local CTV news reporters speculate that the shortfall in hiring of tracers has contributed to the fact that “59% of the province’s COVID-19 cases come from unknown origins”. See CTV news website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210107192656/https://calgary.ctvnews.ca/yardsticks-always-being-moved-alberta-fails-to-meet-its-2020-target-for-contact-tracers-1.5255966

In the 8 January Globe and Mail print edition, western Canadian affairs columnist Gary Mason concludes that “in the worst-hit provinces in this country, such as Quebec, Ontario and Alberta, contact tracers have been overwhelmed by the sheer number of cases”. Mason’s conclusion is impressionistic without much in the way of data, but is consistent with other recent reports about contact tracing backlogs. See article on Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210108135121/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/opinion/article-canadas-overwhelmed-contact-tracing-efforts-have-been-a-gross-failure/

Effective 8 December, the Province of Alberta extended the mask requirement in indoor public spaces to the entire province. See Government of Alberta website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201211114009/https://www.alberta.ca/release.cfm?xID=75859ADEA5D5E-045D-2386-0CB140C175A800DD

On 9 December, Health Canada approved Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine “for use in people 16 years of age or older”. “Canada will receive up to 249,000 doses” later this month. The federal government is arranging distribution to provincial governments with the first group of high-priority recipients expected to receive vaccinations before year end. See Government of Canada websites, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201210205358/https://www.canada.ca/en/health-canada/news/2020/12/health-canada-authorizes-first-covid-19-vaccine0.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20201210210347/https://www.canada.ca/en/public-services-procurement/news/2020/12/canada-to-receive-early-delivery-of-pfizer-biontech-covid-19-vaccine.html

On 10 December, Prime Minister Trudeau repeated the Government of Canada’s commitment that the covid-19 “vaccine would be completely free for all Canadians”. See Global News website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201216164929/https://globalnews.ca/news/7514966/coronavirus-canada-vaccine-rollout-trudeau/

On 14 December, Ontario began vaccinating health care workers in Toronto and Quebec vaccinated workers and residents at long-term care facilities in Montreal and Quebec City. Other provinces are expected to start targeted vaccinations of high-risk groups later this week. See Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201216165500/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-canada-administers-its-first-covid-19-vaccine-shots/  https://web.archive.org/web/20201214190242/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-ontario-personal-support-worker-first-person-in-canada-to-receive-dose/

On 15 December, British Columbia, Alberta, and Saskatchewan began vaccinating front-line health care workers.  See Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201219203531/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/british-columbia/article-western-canada-long-complex-job-of-covid-19-vaccinations-begins/

On 16 December, Nova Scotia, Newfoundland and Labrador, Prince Edward Island, and Manitoba began vaccinating front-line health care workers.  See Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201219202229/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-manitoba-three-atlantic-provinces-to-begin-covid-19-vaccinations-today/

On 19 December, the Canadian Press news service reported that the Province of New Brunswick began vaccinations starting with front-line health care workers and long-term care residents. See Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221203858/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-coronavirus-updates-dec-19-vaccinations-now-underway-in-all-provinces/?cu_id=A6KwM2NPqY9Tjy01oPJvjyThBi3rn%2FLU

On 23 December, Health Canada authorized use of the Moderna vaccine to immunize against covid-19. Delivery and distribution expected before year-end. See Government of Canada website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210102132802/https://healthycanadians.gc.ca/recall-alert-rappel-avis/hc-sc/2020/74621a-eng.php

On 28 December, Andre Picard, health reporter at the Globe and Mail newspaper, commented on what he viewed as slow progress delivering vaccinations in Canada. See article in Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210102220132/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-covid-19-didnt-take-a-holiday-and-the-vaccine-rollout-should-not-have/?cu_id=A6KwM2NPqY9Tjy01oPJvjyThBi3rn%2FLU

On 29 December, Canadian Press news service reported on plans in several provinces to accelerate vaccinations. See article in Globe and Mail newspaper website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210102222357/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-ontario-reports-nearly-4500-new-covid-19-cases-over-two-days/

On 30 December, vaccinations began in remote indigenous communities in British Columbia (BC). Members of three groups -- long-term care residents, frontline workers, remote indigenous community residents -- have now been vaccinated somewhere in Canada. Vaccinations are expected to start soon in indigenous communities in other provinces. However, to my knowledge, there is no province that has vaccinated members of more than 2 groups at this time. See article in Globe and Mail newspaper website and Province of BC website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210103010814/https://www.theglobeandmail.com/canada/article-vaccine-rollout-picks-up-speed-in-first-nations-across-canada/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210104162416/http://www.bccdc.ca/health-info/diseases-conditions/covid-19/covid-19-vaccine/bcs-plan-for-vaccine-distribution

As of 4 January 2021, 11:18AM EST, according to the Canadian Television (CTV) News covid-19 vaccine tracker, 121,295 Canadians or 0.3% of the national population have received vaccinations. See CTV News website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210104165037/https://www.ctvnews.ca/health/coronavirus/covid-19-vaccine-tracker-how-many-people-in-canada-have-received-shots-1.5247509

As of 8 January 10:30AM EST, according to the CTV News covid-19 vaccine tracker, 231,807 Canadians have received a covid-19 vaccination or 0.6% of the national population. See CTV News website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210106182429/https://www.ctvnews.ca/health/coronavirus/coronavirus-vaccine-tracker-how-many-people-in-canada-have-received-shots-1.5247509

The Regional Stay Home Order, announced in California on December 3, 2020 is still in effect. https://archive.vn/aX3BT  Also other states such as North Carolina etc. mandated curfews - http://web.archive.org/web/20201221231005/https://www.nc.gov/covid-19/staying-ahead-curve

New York now requires all visitors from non-contiguous states to self-isolate or provide evidence of a test.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201213024100/https://coronavirus.health.ny.gov/covid-19-travel-advisory#:~:text=For%2520travelers%2520who%2520were%2520out,must%2520obtain%2520another%2520COVID%2520test.
Covid-19 travel restrictions state by state - https://archive.vn/wf9fC

Traveler/visitors to and residents of New Hampshire need to self-quarantine for 10 days following the last date of any travel domestically outside the surrounding new England states. http://web.archive.org/web/20201221232912/https://www.covidguidance.nh.gov/out-state-visitors     Out-of-state travelers arriving in New York who want to opt out of a 14-day quarantine requirement must get tested within three days before arriving, quarantine for three days upon arrival and get tested again on day four. Both tests must be negative to avoid a 14-day quarantine. Essential workers and travelers from bordering states are exempt.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221233311/https://coronavirus.health.ny.gov/covid-19-travel-advisory     All out-of-state travelers coming into Maine, and Maine residents returning to Maine, must either receive a negative COVID-19 test within 72 hours prior to arrival or complete a 10-day quarantine.  https://archive.vn/FeGA4

State Travel restrictions as reported by the New York Times - https://archive.vn/bhQ9m  Many states still require quarantine or a negative covid-19 test. In California nonessential travel is banned statewide except in a region north of Sonoma County.
Travelers from certain countries are prohibited from the United States.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201213024449/https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/from-other-countries.html
Travelers from certain countries ( e.g. China, Iran, United Kingdom etc.)are prohibited from Entry into the US - specific exemptions may apply. https://archive.vn/Oh89R

The United States has restricted the entry of all foreign nationals who have passed through or have been in China, Iran, Most European Countries, UK, Ireland and Brazil in the past 14 days.  Sources   CDC - https://archive.vn/b8vqe  Kayak - https://archive.vn/0mvef

Lawmakers struck a nearly $900 billion COVID-19 stimulus deal Sunday 20th December that includes another round of stimulus checks and jobless benefits for Americans. The deal includes restarting a $300 boost to the federal unemployment insurance benefit, extending eviction moratoriums for renters by a month and a $600 direct payment to most Americans. http://web.archive.org/web/20201222002401if_/https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/12/20/stimulus-checks-unemployment-benefits-economy-covid-relief-package/3921356001/     http://web.archive.org/web/20201222002909/https://edition.cnn.com/2020/12/20/politics/stimulus-latest-shutdown-deadline/index.html

On the 27th of December, President Donald Trump signed the $900 billion pandemic relief bill into law that includes enhanced unemployment benefits and direct cash payments. The jobless will receive a $300 weekly federal enhancement in benefits through March 14. Also, the package extends by 11 weeks two other pandemic unemployment programs that were created in the CARES Act in March and were set to expire at end of 2020.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210104231931/https://edition.cnn.com/2020/12/20/politics/second-covid-stimulus-package-details/index.html

Temporary halt in residential eviction is still in effect until December 31st. http://web.archive.org/web/20201221123939/https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/eviction-moratoria-order-faqs.pdf

On the 27th of December, President Donald Trump signed the $900 billion pandemic relief bill into law. The package also includes rent assistance, nutrition assistance, small business loans, Grants for theaters and other live venues, funding for schools and child care etc. Refer to link below for more information  http://web.archive.org/web/20210104231931/https://edition.cnn.com/2020/12/20/politics/second-covid-stimulus-package-details/index.html

In some states testing is generally available. In Arizona, for instance, test providers accept most insurance and do not require symptoms.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201213024848/https://www.maricopa.gov/5588/COVID-19-Testing

On the 15th December, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration issued an emergency use authorization (EUA) for the first over-the-counter (OTC) fully at-home diagnostic test for COVID-19. The Ellume COVID-19 Home Test is a rapid, lateral flow antigen test, a type of test that runs a liquid sample along a surface with reactive molecules. The test detects fragments of proteins of the SARS-CoV-2 virus from a nasal swab sample from any individual 2 years of age or older.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221163814/https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/coronavirus-covid-19-update-fda-authorizes-antigen-test-first-over-counter-fully-home-diagnostic

First Covid-19 vaccines in US were administered on 14th December 2020. High-risk health care workers are the first in line for inoculations.     New York - http://web.archive.org/web/20201222015252/https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2020/12/14/first-covid-vaccines-new-york/     Michigan - http://web.archive.org/web/20201222015925/https://www.michigan.gov/coronavirus/0,9753,7-406-98158-547433--,00.html     According to the CDC Website - Because the supply of COVID-19 vaccine in the United States is expected to be limited at first, CDC recommends that initial supplies of COVID-19 vaccine be allocated to healthcare personnel and long-term care facility residents.  Hence, coded as Two groups. http://web.archive.org/web/20201222015702/https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/recommendations.html     Code change from zero because according to Forbes, The federal government’s has ordered a total of 200 million doses so far from Moderna, which is enough to immunize 100 million Americans because the vaccine requires two shots. This is more than 20% of the population.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201222024503if_/https://www.forbes.com/sites/joewalsh/2020/12/11/us-ordered-100-million-extra-doses-of-modernas-covid-vaccine/?sh=1666247f3ef3

On the 18th of December, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration issued an emergency use authorization (EUA) for the second vaccine for the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). The emergency use authorization allows the Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine to be distributed in the U.S. for use in individuals 18 years of age and older.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221163049/https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/fda-takes-additional-action-fight-against-covid-19-issuing-emergency-use-authorization-second-covid

According to the CDC website, as at 20th of December 2,838,225 doses had been distributed and 556,208 vaccines doses had been administered. Total doses distributed are cumulative counts of COVID-19 vaccine doses recorded as shipped in the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s (CDC) Vaccine Tracking System (VTrckS) since December 13, 2020.  Cumulative totals reflect data available as of 1:00 pm on the day of reporting. Total doses administered are cumulative counts of individual COVID-19 vaccine doses as reported to the CDC by state, territorial, and local public health agencies and five federal entities (Bureau of Prisons, Veterans Administration, Department of Defense, Department of State, and Indian Health Services) since December 14, 2020.  Cumulative doses administered reflect current data available as of 1:00 pm on the day of reporting.  Doses distributed and administered are for Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine only at this time.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221164321/https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/index.html

According to the CDC Vaccination tracker, 15.4m doses of the vaccine has been distributed and 4.5m people have received the first dose of the Vaccine by 4th January 2021. Doses distributed and people initiating vaccination (1st dose received) are for both Moderna and Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine.   https://archive.vn/NYHlH
